Package ohos.workscheduler

Class WorkInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.workscheduler.WorkInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public final class WorkInfo
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Defines the conditions for triggering a work.

    WorkInfo is set by Particle Ability and used in WorkScheduler and WorkSchedulerService. You can use the methods provided by WorkInfo to query the configured triggering conditions.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.ResourceSchedule#WORK_SCHEDULER

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  WorkInfo.Builder
      Represents the builder class of WorkInfo objects that specify triggering conditions of a work.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ohos.utils.Sequenceable

        Sequenceable.Producer<T>

      Indicates the work is triggered when a low battery level alarm is reported.

      Indicates the work is triggered when a low battery level alarm is reported or when the battery is restored from a low battery level.

      Indicates the work is triggered when the battery is restored from a low battery level.

      Indicates the maximum wait time for triggering the work after the device enters the idle state.

      Indicates the maximum delay for triggering the work that is supposed to repeat at the specified interval.

      Indicates the minimum wait time for triggering the work after the device enters the idle state.

      Indicates the minimum number of times the work is triggered.

      Indicates the minimum interval at which the work is triggered.
      static int NETWORK_TYPE_ANY
      Indicates the work is triggered when any network connection is available.
      static int NETWORK_TYPE_BLUETOOTH
      Indicates the work is triggered when a Bluetooth connection is available.
      static int NETWORK_TYPE_ETHERNET
      Indicates the work is triggered when a wire network connection is available.

      Indicates the work is triggered when a mobile network connection is available.
      static int NETWORK_TYPE_WIFI
      Indicates the work is triggered when a WiFi network connection is available.
      static int NETWORK_TYPE_WIFI_P2P
      Indicates the work is triggered when a WiFi P2P connection is available.
      static int STORAGE_LEVEL_LOW
      Indicates the work is triggered when the remaining storage space is insufficient.
      static int STORAGE_LEVEL_LOW_OR_OKAY
      Indicates the work is triggered when the remaining storage is insufficient or when the remaining storage is restored from insufficient space.
      static int STORAGE_LEVEL_OKAY
      Indicates the work is triggered when the remaining storage is restored from insufficient space.

    • Field Detail

      • BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW

        public static final int BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW
        Indicates the work is triggered when a low battery level alarm is reported.

        When WorkScheduler detects that the triggering condition is met, it starts the Particle Ability for which the work is set.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW_OR_OKAY

        public static final int BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW_OR_OKAY
        Indicates the work is triggered when a low battery level alarm is reported or when the battery is restored from a low battery level.

        When WorkScheduler detects that the triggering condition is met, it starts the Particle Ability for which the work is set.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:

      • isWorkInfoValid

        public boolean isWorkInfoValid​()
        Checks whether a WorkInfo object is valid.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the WorkInfo object is valid; returns false otherwise. A WorkInfo object is valid only if ElementName is set to a valid value. A WorkInfo object is invalid if ElementName is not set. In this case, a failure occurs when calling methods such as WorkScheduler#startWork.
        Since:
        3

      • getElementInfo

        public ElementName getElementInfo​()
        Obtains the ElementName in the current WorkInfo object.
        Returns:
        Returns the ElementName. If no ElementName has been set, null may be returned.
        Since:
        3

      • getRequestNetworkType

        public int getRequestNetworkType​()
        Obtains the network type based on which the work is triggered.
        Returns:
        Returns the network type based on which the work is triggered. Depending on your configuration, the return value may contain one or multiple network types.
        Since:
        3

      • getRequestBatteryLevel

        public int getRequestBatteryLevel​()
        Obtains the battery level based on which the work is triggered.
        Returns:
        Returns the battery level based on which the work is triggered. If no battery level has been set, the return value will be 0.
        Since:
        3

      • getRepeatCounter

        public int getRepeatCounter​()
        Obtains the number of times set for repeating the work.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of times set for repeating the work. Note that the return value is not the number of times that the work was triggered.
        Since:
        3

      • getRepeatCycleTime

        public long getRepeatCycleTime​()
